meanings.definition: Intersecting at or forming a right angle.
meanings.sent1: The shelf was placed perpendicular to the wall.
meanings.sent2: The table legs were perpendicular to the floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat perpendicular on top of the narrow fence, looking quite puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules were perpendicular to our laid-back attitude.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches grew perpendicular to the trunk, creating a perfect right angle.

meanings.definition: A line or plane that is perpendicular to another line or plane.
meanings.sent1: The architect drew a perpendicular line to indicate the new wall.
meanings.sent2: The intersection formed a perpendicular with the main road.
meanings.sent3: The pizza slice was cut into perfect perpendiculars, making it easy to share.
meanings.sent4: The teacher used a perpendicular as an example in geometry class.
meanings.sent5: The drone flew in a perpendicular to capture the entire landscape in one shot.
